original_data.question: A 58-year-old man with hypertension and dyslipidemia comes to the physician for a routine health maintenance examination. He says he feels well. He is 180 cm (5 ft 11 in) tall and weighs 103 kg (227 lb); BMI is 32 kg/m2. His BMI last year was 27 kg/m2. When asked about his diet, he says, “Being overweight runs in my family. Rather than fight it, I just try to enjoy myself and eat what I want.” Which of the following defense mechanisms best describes the patient's response to the physician?

model_response:
{'A': 'Rationalization', 'B': 'Fantasy', 'C': 'Distortion', 'D': 'Intellectualization'}[?]Rationalization: A defense mechanism, operating unconsciously, whereby the individual attempts to justify or make consciously tolerable by plausible means, feelings or behavior that otherwise would be intolerable. In the case of the patient, he is attempting to explain his overeating as a genetic trait. This justification allows him to continue his overeating behavior.Fantasy: A defense mechanism, operating unconsciously, whereby the individual escapes from reality by creating a fantasy world. In the case of the patient, he is not using fantasy as a defense mechanism because he is not escaping from reality.Distortion: A defense mechanism, operating unconsciously, whereby the individual distorts either the whole of an event or its interpretation. In the case of the patient, he is not distorting the event of overeating.Intellectualization: A defense mechanism, operating unconsciously, whereby the individual approaches or deals with a painful reality or conflict by overusing the intellect. In the case of the patient, he is using intellectualization as a defense mechanism because he is dealing with the painful reality of being overweight by using his intellect to rationalize his overeating.

###Answer: OPTION A IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Human males as cultural, psychological, sociological, political, and economic entities.

Persistently high systemic arterial BLOOD PRESSURE. Based on multiple readings (BLOOD PRESSURE DETERMINATION), hypertension is currently defined as when SYSTOLIC PRESSURE is consistently greater than 140 mm Hg or when DIASTOLIC PRESSURE is consistently 90 mm Hg or more.
A lipoprotein metabolism disorder characterized by decreased levels of high-density lipoproteins, or elevated levels of plasma cholesterol, low-density lipoproteins and/or triglycerides.
Having a black or dark core or plug.
Individuals licensed to practice medicine.
An unvarying or habitual method or procedure.
The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease.
Systematic and thorough inspection of the patient for physical signs of disease or abnormality.
Emotional sensations.
The mass or quantity of heaviness of an individual. It is expressed by units of pounds or kilograms.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
Regular course of eating and drinking adopted by a person or animal.
A condition in which body mass index falls between 25 and 29.9.
A social group consisting of parents or parent substitutes and children.
A question about an individual's total assessment of their abilities.
The consumption of edible substances.

Unconscious process used by an individual or a group of individuals in order to cope with impulses, feelings or ideas which are not acceptable at their conscious level; various types include reaction formation, projection and self reversal.

Fundamental claims of patients, as expressed in statutes, declarations, or generally accepted moral principles. (Bioethics Thesaurus) The term is used for discussions of patient rights as a group of many rights, as in a hospital's posting of a list of patient rights.
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.
Individuals licensed to practice medicine.
